intro: Stichorkis laxa, commonly known as the slender stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Stichorkis laxa is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its island environment.
